p: Our data demonstrated that RN leaf powder supplementation considerably reduced bloody diarrhea in the challenged birds. A reduction in blood loss can help defend the infected broilers from secondary bacterial invasion, inflammatory reactions, and absorption of toxic compounds [ 53]. The anti-diarrheal activity of RN may be attributed to therapeutic effects such as intestinal motility reduction and direct anti-coccidial activity. It may be due to the fact that RN contains a higher amount of the flavonoid compound “quercetin”, which hinders the release of acetylcholine into the digestive tract, an assumption supported by similar claims made by [ 54].
